The number of repeats for sufficiently big periods. Default value: 1.
Defines how much better must be the period T than T/2, T/3 etc. to be accepted. Default value: 0.05f.
Defines if and how sub-point precision is achieved.
Autocorrelation values for consecutive period values.
Estimated period length.
Correlation value for the estimated period length.

Input fitting map.
Parameters controlling the edge extraction process.
Selection mode of edges. Default value: avl::Selection::Best.

member.summary: Precomputes a data object that is required for fast path fitting on surfaces.
member.param: Dimensions, depth image pixel type, coordinate offsets and scales of a surface on which path fitting will be performed.
Defines a stripe in which scan segments will be created.
The width of each scan field in pixels of the surface depth image. Default value: 5.
Interpolation method used for extraction of depth image pixel values. Default value: avl::InterpolationMethod::NearestNeighbour.
Optimized data required for path fitting.

member.name: M:AvlNet.AVL.CreatePathFittingMap(AvlNet.ImageFormat,AvlNet.PathFittingField,System.Int32,AvlNet.InterpolationMethod,AvlNet.PathFittingMap@)
member.summary: Precomputes a data object that is required for fast path fitting on images.
member.param: Dimensions, depth and pixel type of the images on which fitting will be performed.
Defines a stripe in which scan segments will be created.
The width of each scan field (in pixels). Default value: 5.

member.name: M:AvlNet.AVL.AdjustPathArrayToEdges(AvlNet.Image,AvlNet.Path[],System.Single,AvlNet.AdjustmentMetric,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Single,AvlNet.Path[]@,AvlNet.CoordinateSystem2D@)
member.summary: Translates, rotates and scales the given contour set to the edges of the input image with subpixel precision.
member.param: Input image.
Paths to be adjusted. For sparse, synthetic paths the inPointSpacing needs to be specified.
Expected initial distance between inPaths and edges of the input image. Default value: 2.0f.

Metric used for path attraction. The SegmentDistance minimizes distances along path normal vectors, and thus adjustment is more accurate. PointDistance_* minimize euclidean distance, adjustment tends to be more stable. Default value: SegmentDistance.
Compute the translation part of adjustment transform. Must be true when using AttractPathTangents estimation method. Default value: True.
Compute the rotation part of adjustment transform. Default value: True.
Compute the scale part of adjustment transform. Default value: False.
Number of iterations of internal adjustment algorithm. Default value: 6.
Threshold for suppression of weak input image gradients. Increase for very noisy images. Default value: 1.0f.
Adjusted output paths.
Corrected alignment - the inAlignment input modified with estimated adjustment parameters.

Golden edge template containing image with no defects.
Adjusts the golden template to the position of the inspected object.
Amount of horizontal smoothing used by the edge filter. Default value: 2.0f.
Sufficient edge strength; edges of that strength will always be detected on the input image. Default value: 35.0f.

Maximal allowed distance between corresponding edges on the input and golden image. Default value: 3.
Region of detected defects.
Flag indicating whether any defects were detected.
Edges present on the golden image that are missing on the input image.
Edges that are not present on the golden image.

member.summary: Finds the camera intrinsic and extrinsic parameters from the input arrays of image and real-world coordinates. Uses pinhole camera model (perspective camera).
member.param: Array, for each view: array of 3D points of the calibration pattern.
Array, for each view: array of corresponding 2D points in the picture.
Image width, only used to initialize camera matrix, not used when inInitialCameraMatrix present. Default value: 640.
Image height, only used to initialize camera matrix, not used when inInitialCameraMatrix present. Default value: 480.
The principal point is not changed during the global optimization. It stays in the center of the image, or as in the initial camera matrix.
The functions considers only fy as a free parameter. The ratio fx/fy stays 1, or as in the initial camera matrix.
Tangential distortion coefficients (p_1, p_2) are assumed zero.
Image scale: px / mm.

The functions considers only fy as a free parameter. The ratio fx/fy stays 1, or as in the initial camera matrix.
Tangential distortion coefficients (p_1, p_2) are assumed zero.
Optional initial camera matrix, required for inFixPrincipalPoint and inFixAspectRatio. Default value: atl::NIL, or null.
Image scale: px / mm.

member.name: M:AvlNet.AVL.FormatPoint3DToString(AvlNet.Point3D,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String@)
member.summary: Converts a 3D point to a string of format "(X, Y, Z)".
member.param: How many characters the integer part of the coordinates should have at least.
How many characters the fractional part of the coordinates should have. Default value: 3.
The symbol used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of the coordinates. Default value: \".\".
Defines the trailing character. Default value: \"0\".
Forces printing the signs of the numbers even if the number is positive. Default value: False.
Defines a suffix. Generally it is an unit of value (eg. mm). Default value: \"\".

member.summary: Enhances contrast of an image so that it appears sharper.

Value representing the strength of the contrast enhancement. Default value: 1.0f.
Kernel shape.
Nearly half of the kernel's width (2*R+1). Default value: 1.
Nearly half of the kernel's height (2*R+1), or same as inRadiusX. Default value: atl::NIL.
Output image.

member.summary: Fills in a region of the image with pixel values interpolated from the borders of the area.
member.param: Ratio between vertical and horizontal interpolation. Default value: 0.5f.
Region to be inpainted.

member.summary: Normalizes local contrast of the image using Wallis filter.
member.param: Monochromatic input image.
Range of pixels to be processed. Default value: atl::NIL.
Target local mean. Default value: 128.0f.
Target local variance. Default value: 90.0f.
Radius of neighbourhood to uniformize. Default value: 10.
How much of original brightness to be kept. Default value: 0.1f.
Output image.

member.summary: Maps image pixels to new values to achieve uniform distribution of intensities in the range (0, 255).
member.param: Input image.
Range of pixels to be processed. Default value: atl::NIL.
Fraction of the brightest pixels skipped during normalization. Default value: 0.0f.
Fraction of the darkest pixels skipped during normalization. Default value: 0.0f.
Output image.

member.summary: Rescales an image linearly, so that its minimum becomes inNewMinimum and the maximum of the remaining pixels becomes inNewMaximum.
member.param: Input image.
Range of pixels to be processed. Default value: atl::NIL.
Desired minimum value of the resulting image. Default value: 0.0f.
Desired maximum value of the resulting image. Default value: 255.0f.
Fraction of the brightest pixels skipped during normalization. Default value: 0.0f.
Fraction of the darkest pixels skipped during normalization. Default value: 0.0f.
Rescaled image.
Multiplicative parameter of the applied linear transformation of pixel values.
Additive parameter of the applied linear transformation of pixel values.
Region of image that has been linearly normalized.
